DOC.brief_summary: This study aim evaluate effect mobile phone-based dietary physical activity intervention body fatness , dietary intake physical activity preschooler
DOC.brief_title: A web-and Mobile Phone-based Intervention 4-year-olds : Population-based Randomized Controlled Trial
DOC.detailed_description: Childhood overweight obesity increase health problem globally , establish early 2-5 year age . Mobile phone base ( mHealth ) intervention successful weight management adult ; however , potential young child yet establish . Therefore , ultimate goal MINISTOP ( Mobile-based INtervention Intended STop Obesity Preschoolers ) trial help parent four year old child achieve healthy weight body fat via smartphone app ( MINISTOP ) . More specifically trial aim reduce body fat ( primary outcome ) , increase intake fruit , vegetable well decrease intake candy , sweeten beverage , increase amount time spend moderate-to-vigorous physical activity decrease sedentary behavior ( secondary outcome ) healthy preschool age Swedish child . If MINISTOP app effective , potential incorporate child health care aid counteract overweight obesity .
DOC.criteria: parent four year old child living Östergötland ; ability child measure baseline 4.5 year ± 2 month age least one parent able speak read Swedish sufficiently well ( i.e . able provide inform consent understand intervention content ) A child neurological endocrine disease effect weight A child parent suffer serious physical psychological disease make study demand family .
